title: Legal and Governance Terminology
description: Specialized vocabulary for legal discourse and institutional governance

items.definition: The official authority to make legal decisions; the territory within which authority is exercised
items.example: The case falls outside the court's jurisdiction and must be heard elsewhere.

items.definition: A legal decision that serves as an authoritative rule for similar future cases
items.example: The Supreme Court ruling set a precedent for how such cases would be handled.

items.definition: Legal responsibility for one's actions; an obligation to pay or perform
items.example: The company faces significant liability for the environmental damage caused by the spill.

items.definition: The formal judgment or resolution of a dispute by a court or tribunal
items.example: The dispute was resolved through adjudication rather than arbitration.

items.definition: A written law passed by a legislative body
items.example: The statute of limitations prevents prosecution after a certain period.

items.definition: Acting in accordance with rules, regulations, or demands
items.example: Regulatory compliance has become a major concern for financial institutions.

items.definition: A method of dispute resolution using an impartial third party
items.example: The contract requires that disputes be settled through binding arbitration.

items.definition: Security or protection against loss or damage; compensation for loss
items.example: The contract includes an indemnity clause protecting the vendor from third-party claims.
